elements.name: Demographic Questions Intro
elements.html: Please answer the following demographic questions. These questions will help us to understand some general characteristics about our research sample. Note that the information you provide here is strictly confidential.

elements.name: handedness
elements.title: Which hand is your dominant hand? That is, which hand do you use for most tasks, like writing and eating?

choices.text: I can use both hands equally

elements.name: maritalStatus
elements.title: What is your current marital status?

elements.name: ethnicity
elements.title: Which ethnicity do you identify with? (check all that apply)

elements.name: language
elements.title: How well do you speak English?

choices.text: I am a native English speaker (I was learning English when I was born).
English is my second (or third, etc.) language, but I am completely fluent.
I am NOT a fully fluent speaker of English.

elements.name: education
elements.title: What is your highest educational attainment?

choices.text: Some college, associate or community-college degree

elements.name: income
elements.title: What is your household's total yearly income? (If financially independent put your own income)

elements.name: politic
elements.title: How would you describe your political orientation?

elements.name: videoGames
elements.title: How often do you play video games?

choices.text: I play video games once a year or less.
I play video games about once a month.
I play video game a few times a month.
I play video games several times a week.
I play video games every day.

elements.name: Substance Explanation
elements.html:
The next few questions ask you about your use of alcohol and recreational drugs. We wish to emphasize three things:

  • You are NOT required to answer these questions.
  • If you choose to answer, the information will remain completely unidentifiable (as will all information you provide during this study).
  • Your compensation will not depend on your answers to these questions.

We ask these questions because the results of the tasks you just performed depend on small differences in reaction time. We would like to have this information so that we can examine the difference in performance when people have used substances.

elements.name: substance
elements.title: In the last 3 hours, have you used...

elements.name: alcohol quantity
elements.title: How many drinks have you had in the past 3 hours?

elements.name: overallReaction
elements.title: What did you think of the tasks you performed during this study? Provide any feedback you have here.

elements.name: taskRepeat
elements.title: Have you ever done a task like this before?

elements.name: priorTaskTime
elements.title: How long ago did you do the similar task?

elements.name: priorTaskDescription
elements.title: Briefly describe the similar task that you did.
